slides.title: HCF (Highest Common Factor)
slides.content:
**HCF:** Largest number that divides all given numbers

Also called **GCD (Greatest Common Divisor)**

**Example:** HCF of 12 and 18
Factors of 12: 1,2,3,4,6,12
Factors of 18: 1,2,3,6,9,18
Common: 1,2,3,6
HCF = 6

slides.title: LCM (Lowest Common Multiple)
slides.content:
**LCM:** Smallest number that is divisible by all given numbers

**Example:** LCM of 4 and 6
Multiples of 4: 4,8,12,16,20,24...
Multiples of 6: 6,12,18,24,30...
Common: 12,24,36...
LCM = 12

slides.title: Methods to Find HCF
slides.content:
**1. Prime Factorization:**
Find common prime factors with lowest powers

**2. Division Method:**
Divide larger by smaller repeatedly

**Example:** HCF of 24, 36
24 = 2³ × 3
36 = 2² × 3²
HCF = 2² × 3 = 12

slides.title: Methods to Find LCM
slides.content:
**Prime Factorization:**
Take all prime factors with highest powers

**Example:** LCM of 12, 18
12 = 2² × 3
18 = 2 × 3²
LCM = 2² × 3² = 36

slides.title: Important Formulas
slides.content:
**For two numbers a and b:**

**LCM × HCF = a × b**

**LCM of fractions:**
LCM = (LCM of numerators)/(HCF of denominators)

**HCF of fractions:**
HCF = (HCF of numerators)/(LCM of denominators)
